benchmark_details.name: MeDAL (Medical Abbreviation Disambiguation Dataset for Natural Language Understanding Pretraining)
benchmark_details.overview: MeDAL is a large medical text dataset curated for abbreviation disambiguation, designed for natural language understanding pre-training in the medical domain.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable effective pre-training and improve performance on downstream medical tasks during fine-tuning.

data.source: Created from PubMed abstracts released in 2019
data.annotation: Generated using reverse substitution techniques, without human labeling.

methodology.calculation: Top-k recall is calculated as the number of diagnosis codes present in the top k predictions of the model divided by the total number of diagnosis codes in that admission.
methodology.interpretation: Higher top-k recall values indicate better performance of models at predicting relevant diagnoses.
methodology.baseline_results: LSTM: 82.80% test accuracy (pre-trained), ELECTRA: 84.43% test accuracy (pre-trained)
